messages.title: Lothian and Borders Police
messages.content: Keep our police local - Labour left the UK paying £120 million a day in debt interest alone. Enough to build a new primary school every hour.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Oppose the Labour and SNP plans to abolish Lothian and Borders Police and create a single centralised National Scottish Police Force. Policing should be local.

issues.economy: Labour left the UK paying £120 million a day in debt interest alone.

leaflet.personalStatement: I was very worried about the coalition, particularly tuition fees, but Mike is against them. This is a Scottish Election so it’s a bit different. I think I’m voting for Mike.

politicalExperience.achievements: Ran a bakery locally for 40 years.

endorsements.endorsement: I was very worried about the coalition, particularly tuition fees, but Mike is against them. This is a Scottish Election so it’s a bit different. I think I’m voting for Mike.

quotes.text: Labour left the UK paying £120 million a day in debt interest alone. Enough to build a new primary school every hour.

images.caption: Leaflet image with a summary of key message regarding police and a photo of Mike Pringle.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet seems to be addressing the issue of local versus centralised policing, using the cost of debt interest to underscore fiscal responsibility.
